results.brief_description: Explains the nature of cold working operations; crystalline structure of aluminum alloys; slip planes and deformation; microstructure changes during cold working; microstructure changes during annealing; cold working operations; and annealing operations.

results.title: Heat rays
results.brief_description: Instructional film analysing the relationship between heat and light radiation; the sun as a source of light and heat, making a photograph with light and heat rays; applications and uses of heat rays; reflection, refraction and movement of heat rays; applications of these properties of heat rays to everyday life; relationships between heat and light as a form of vibration of electro-magnetic waves of different frequencies; the role of heat rays in maintaining life on this planet.

results.title: Heat causes expansion
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Shows two children carrying out experiments in their home to prove that solids, liquids and gases expand when heated. Also shows many ways in which this law of physics occurs in everyday life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Heat = Andy Warhol presents Heat
results.creator_credit: Score Movies, Andy Warhol and Paul Morrissey
results.brief_description: Largely interpreted as a send-up of “Sunset Boulevard”, this is the story of Joe (Joe Dallesandro) a handsome, ambitious would-be actor who, whilst staying in a shoddy LA Motel, sleeps with an array of staff and customers, anyone in fact who he believes will further his career. Joe displays all the hallmarks of a jaded hustler - a man beyond enjoyment of sex, but one for whom sex is the main currency. The final instalment of the “Flesh/Trash/Heat” trilogy, between Paul Morrissey, Joe Dallesandro and Andy Warhol, this is the most linear of their work and the least experimental. It contains some wonderfully satirical humour whilst remaining focused (as “Heat” and “Trash” did also) on Dallesandro’s physical beauty. Cast also includes Sylvia Miles, Ray Vestal, Andrea Feldman and Pat Ast.

results.title: Hearts of the world
results.creator_credit: D W Griffith Productions, War Office Committee and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: After producing BIRTH OF A NATION and INTOLERANCE Griffith was commissioned by the American government to produce a propaganda film for the Allies in World War 1. Although not in the same class as his two masterpieces, HEARTS OF THE WORLD is nevertheless well in the Griffith tradition of striking sets, visual flair and spectacular battle scenes. A group of youngsters grow up and love in a peaceful French village. But war intrudes and peace is shattered. The German army invades and occupies village, bringing both destruction and torture. The young people of the village resist, some successfully, others tragically, until French troops retake the town. Stars Lillian Gish, Robert Harron, Dorothy Gish, Adolphe Lestina and Josephine Crowell. Noel Coward and Erich von Stroheim play small parts.

results.title: Hearts in paradise
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Judith Hewitson
results.brief_description: The lifestyle of Jo, a new wave singer, is compared and contrasted with Teresa, a would-be mothercraft worker. This is viewed against the background of society’s general resistance and non-comprehension of that which is new and different.

results.title: Hearts and minds
results.brief_description: The evolution of civilization throughout the world is contrasted with the lack of development, the exploitation, and agony of Vietnam, through the ages. Problems of power, human rights, domestic politics, national prestige, and development of economy are so involved with fallible political processes; “Peace”, “Ceasefire”, “Negotiation”, become meaningless re-iterations. Petty’s first film comprising footage that he shot on a trip to Vietnam combined with animation of some of his newspape cartoons. Accompanied with music by George Dreyfus, the narrative builds to a strong anti-war statement.

results.title: Heartlands: diversity or dust
results.brief_description: Narrated by Richard Bawden this episode looks at a small group of farmers who have developed a meaningful relationship with the land. When these farmers arrived on their selections in Western Australia in the fifties, they were required by the Lands Department to clear a certain percentage of their land. Initially, believing that opening up the land and growing wheat was a worthy enterprise, they readily cleared the native bush. As time went on some of them realised that this practice was doing great damage, increasing salinity and rendering the land barren. Gradually they developed an understanding of the balance of the natural environment, and realised that the ‘empty’ land they had settled contained plant species of enormous diversity. Led by Veronica Kingdon, the farmers conducted and won a campaign against the Lands Department. Their political lobbying has stopped all major land clearing in the state. Their efforts also contributed to the establishment of Fitzgerald National Park, one of the richest botanical regions in the world. Now self-taught botanists, geologists, nature photographers and seed collectors they conduct a wildflower show each year to raise awareness about plant diversity in the region. Their efforts are a model for showing how a small group of dedicated individuals can bring about profound change.

results.title: Heartlands with Dean Graetz : water
results.brief_description: Other civilisations have ignored the warning signs that Australia is currently receiving regarding salinity. Salinity poses a major ecological problem to Australia in the forms of land erosion along the coastline, and destroying food and water supplies inland. It has occurred because we have taken too much from the land and the natural barriers to salinity have broken down. This documentary interviews a Murray River farmer, attempts to explain why the situation has occurred, and searches for a solution for the future.
